response:
The priority is to confirm or refute multifocal CNS demyelination, define the extent and activity of lesions, and exclude structural, vascular, infectious, and metabolic mimics that can cause optic neuropathy and a crossed brainstem syndrome.

investigations = ["MRI of brain, orbits, cervical and thoracic spine with gadolinium contrast", "Lumbar puncture with CSF cell count, protein, glucose, oligoclonal bands and IgG index", "Visual evoked potentials", "Optical coherence tomography of the optic nerve and macula", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Serum glucose", "HbA1c", "Serum vitamin B12", "Serum folate", "Thyroid function tests", "Serum copper", "Serum ACE level", "Antinuclear antibody", "Extractable nuclear antigen antibodies", "Anti-double-stranded DNA antibody", "Aquaporin-4 IgG antibody", "Myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein IgG antibody", "Serum protein electrophoresis and immunofixation", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology", "Nerve conduction studies and electromyography", "High-resolution CT chest"]
